discourse_list.title: Dear beloved Maker community! I missed you all!

content.content: It has come to my attention that my recent posts on Twitter have resurfaced discussions surrounding rounding errors. I wholeheartedly sympathize with all of you on this point. How can progress be made if all of the DAO’s members’ mental bandwidths and energies are not entirely focused on addressing such matters? A functional organization such as ours should never stand for such things under any circumstance. Every penny must be accounted for. Most importantly, the collective energy invested towards these ends is, without question, justified. So, to that end… despite my long hiatus, I see many remain faithful to this highest value.    During the brief time of my mandate and my core unit’s existence, although I was consistently delivering deliverables… despite my best efforts, distributing at every conference, drop shipping to North of 200 or 250 recipients, alas, there was a decent batch merch that remained. And my earlier tweet? To even suggest selling this stuff privately? How dare I? Truly unacceptable & inappropriate. I deeply deeply regret my earlier behavior. The audacity I had even to post such a thing… is truly unforgivable. I had already received my lead parachute after my offboarding… and for me to show no gratitude? Unacceptable. Regrettably, this will be difficult for me to live down.  OK… that’s probably enough sarcasm for a public forum! If anyone has an issue with my trying to unload the remnants of this merch publically…  please, don’t be shy! Let me know personally. <3  If the community misses this particular batch of merch so much, I would be more than happy to accept fair compensation to distribute it (and much more) at our next event/s. If we’re still undecided about what “fair compensation” is, I’m more than happy to participate in that discussion. However, if somehow, I’m expected to continue to pay out of my own pocket going forward (like I did for years before any budget for me was passed)… even to simply “return” the few boxes of merch. Well… just going to leave with "thank you for the great memories and connections. I truly enjoyed working with so many of you. <3
